title: Google\Cloud\Kms\V1\CryptoKey
name: CryptoKey
description:
A [CryptoKey][google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKey] represents a logical key that can be used for cryptographic operations.

A [CryptoKey][google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKey] is made up of one or more [versions][google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKeyVersion], which represent the actual key material used in cryptographic operations.

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKey

Extends \Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.name
params.description: Output only. The resource name for this [CryptoKey][google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKey] in the format projects/*/locations/*/keyRings/*/cryptoKeys/*.

params.name: data.primary
params.description: Output only. A copy of the "primary" [CryptoKeyVersion][google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKeyVersion] that will be used by [Encrypt][google.cloud.kms.v1.KeyManagementService.Encrypt] when this [CryptoKey][google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKey] is given in [EncryptRequest.name][google.cloud.kms.v1.EncryptRequest.name]. The [CryptoKey][google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKey]'s primary version can be updated via [UpdateCryptoKeyPrimaryVersion][google.cloud.kms.v1.KeyManagementService.UpdateCryptoKeyPrimaryVersion].

params.name: data.purpose
params.description: The immutable purpose of this [CryptoKey][google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKey]. Currently, the only acceptable purpose is [ENCRYPT_DECRYPT][google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKey.CryptoKeyPurpose.ENCRYPT_DECRYPT].

params.name: data.create_time
params.description: Output only. The time at which this [CryptoKey][google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKey] was created.

params.name: data.next_rotation_time
params.description: At [next_rotation_time][google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKey.next_rotation_time], the Key Management Service will automatically: 1. Create a new version of this [CryptoKey][google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKey]. 2. Mark the new version as primary. Key rotations performed manually via [CreateCryptoKeyVersion][google.cloud.kms.v1.KeyManagementService.CreateCryptoKeyVersion] and [UpdateCryptoKeyPrimaryVersion][google.cloud.kms.v1.KeyManagementService.UpdateCryptoKeyPrimaryVersion] do not affect [next_rotation_time][google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKey.next_rotation_time].

params.name: data.rotation_period
params.description: [next_rotation_time][google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKey.next_rotation_time] will be advanced by this period when the service automatically rotates a key. Must be at least one day. If [rotation_period][google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKey.rotation_period] is set, [next_rotation_time][google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKey.next_rotation_time] must also be set.

params.name: data.labels
params.description: Labels with user-defined metadata. For more information, see Labeling Keys.

methods.name: getNextRotationTime
methods.description:
At [next_rotation_time][google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKey.next_rotation_time], the Key Management Service will automatically:

  1. Create a new version of this [CryptoKey][google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKey].

  2. Mark the new version as primary. Key rotations performed manually via [CreateCryptoKeyVersion][google.cloud.kms.v1.KeyManagementService.CreateCryptoKeyVersion] and [UpdateCryptoKeyPrimaryVersion][google.cloud.kms.v1.KeyManagementService.UpdateCryptoKeyPrimaryVersion] do not affect [next_rotation_time][google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKey.next_rotation_time].

Generated from protobuf field .google.protobuf.Timestamp next_rotation_time = 7;

If [rotation_period][google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKey.rotation_period] is set, [next_rotation_time][google.cloud.kms.v1.CryptoKey.next_rotation_time] must also be set.
